title: How The Capture faked its CCTV footage – and how it could be done in real life
text:
Can CCTV be trusted? And with Britain one of the most surveilled countries on earth, could The Capture become reality? Mark Doman, the video artist behind the BBC thriller, reveals all

The Capture either begins with an assault, or it doesn’t. In the opening moments of the law-and-order thriller, which concludes on BBC One tonight, a council worker on the night shift is watching the local CCTV when she spots a couple at a bus stop, alone. The man has caught the woman up; they appear to talk; he shuffles awkwardly, she goes in for a kiss. A bus slides past, hiding them momentarily. And then he’s beating her to the ground, and dragging her body away.
